intro: Agapetes obliqua, commonly known as the zigzag heath, is a species of flowering plant in the Ericaceae family. It is native to the Andean regions of South America, particularly in countries like Ecuador and Peru. The plant is characterized by its compact, evergreen shrub form with dense clusters of small, leathery leaves. Its flowers are typically white or pale pink, arranged in clusters and blooming in the spring. Agapetes obliqua is adapted to high-altitude environments and thrives in cool, moist, acidic soils.
